Generation IV.Diamond: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.
Generation IV.Pearl: It lives in arid lands. It buries itself in sand and lies in wait for unsuspecting prey.
Generation IV.Platinum: As soon as the tail claws close, its needle tips secrete poison. It can survive a year without food.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.

Generation V.Black: As soon as the tail claws close, its needle tips secrete poison. It can survive a year without food.
Generation V.White: As soon as the tail claws close, its needle tips secrete poison. It can survive a year without food.
Generation V.Black 2: It lives in arid regions and can go without food for a year while waiting for prey.
Generation V.White 2: It lives in arid regions and can go without food for a year while waiting for prey.

Generation VI.X: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.
Generation VI.Y: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.

Generation VIII.Sword: After burrowing into the sand, it waits patiently for prey to come near. This Pokémon and Sizzlipede share common descent.
Generation VIII.Shield: It attacks using the claws on its tail. Once locked in its grip, its prey is unable to move as this Pokémon's poison seeps in.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It lives in arid lands. It buries itself in sand and lies in wait for unsuspecting prey.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Its claws are not only razor-sharp but poisonous, making Skorupi a highly dangerous Pokémon. It seems to be weakened by cold temperatures, however.
